execute

public void execute(String documentName)
             throws ParsingException,
                    ExecutionException,
                    DocumentException,
                    IOException
Executes a source code document. The language of the source code will be determined by the document tag, which is usually the filename extension.

Parameters:
documentName - The document name
Throws:
ParsingException
ExecutionException
DocumentException
IOException

executeOnce

public void executeOnce(String documentName)
                 throws ParsingException,
                        ExecutionException,
                        DocumentException,
                        IOException
As execute(String), but will only execute once per this thread.

Parameters:
documentName - The document name
Throws:
ParsingException
ExecutionException
DocumentException
IOException
See Also:
markExecuted(String, boolean)

markExecuted

public boolean markExecuted(String documentName,
                            boolean wasExecuted)
Marks a document as executed for this thread's ExecutionContext.

Parameters:
documentName - The document name
wasExecuted - True if marked as executed, false to clear execution flag
Returns:
True if the document was marked as executed or not by this call, false if it was already marked as such
See Also:
executeOnce(String)

addFileDependency

public void addFileDependency(String documentName)
                       throws ParsingException,
                              DocumentException
Explicitly add a dependency to this document. Unlike addDependency(String), any file can be added here. The contents of the file are never read.

Parameters:
documentName - The document name
Throws:
ParsingException
DocumentException
